poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: The horse is gone. Schoolgirls tend the flame Ignited Nietzsche's madness Hoists him with his own his own Conclusions. As it all hots up The wise man takes a powder, hops it. A horseless carnage honks in: The hawks have it. Blighty is Haufs and hauf-pints in a pub. Snowline down to treeline Where a chalk horse haunts the hill.
